npcs.name: Gareth the Trader
npcs.description: A traveling merchant with connections across the realm

npcs.name: Melody the Bard
npcs.description: A charismatic performer who can draw crowds or drive them away

npcs.name: Captain Erik
npcs.description: The stern but fair captain of the city watch

npcs.name: Nova the Alchemist
npcs.description: An eccentric potion maker with explosive experiments

npcs.name: Thorin Ironbeard
npcs.description: A wealthy dwarf merchant who appreciates fine drinks

npcs.name: Lady Silviana
npcs.description: An elven noble with refined tastes and ancient wisdom

npcs.name: Pip Goodbarrel
npcs.description: A cheerful halfling with an enormous appetite

npcs.name: Gruk the Civilized
npcs.description: An orc trying to fit into civilized society

npcs.name: Count Vladimir
npcs.description: A mysterious noble with unusual dietary requirements

npcs.name: Captain Scarlett
npcs.description: A notorious pirate captain with a crew of rowdy sailors

cards.title: Bulk Order Opportunity
cards.description: A merchant wants to stock your ale for his caravan
cards.situation: Gareth enters with a proposition: 'I need 50 barrels of ale for my trade route. I can pay upfront, but I need quality stuff that won't spoil on the road.'

options.text: Accept the order with premium preservation
Accept but use cheaper preservatives
Negotiate for a smaller order you can handle
Decline - too risky for your current capacity

cards.title: Weekly Performance Deal
cards.description: A bard offers to perform regularly at your tavern
cards.situation: Melody strums her lute and proposes: 'Let me perform here every week. I'll draw crowds with my songs and tales. We can split the extra earnings.'

options.text: Agree to weekly performances
Offer a one-time performance first
Suggest a profit-sharing arrangement
Decline - too noisy for regular customers

cards.title: Surprise Inspection
cards.description: The guard captain arrives for a routine inspection
cards.situation: Captain Erik enters with two guards. 'Routine inspection,' he announces. 'We've had reports of watered drinks and short measures. I hope we won't find any violations here.'

options.text: Welcome the inspection confidently
Offer a 'donation' to the guard fund
Stall while staff fixes any issues
Admit to minor violations and pay fines

cards.title: Alchemical Accident
cards.description: An alchemist's experiment goes wrong in your tavern
cards.situation: Nova was mixing potions at a corner table when BOOM! Purple smoke fills the tavern. 'Oops!' she says sheepishly. 'I'll pay for damages... or I could enhance your ale with a special formula instead?'

options.text: Demand immediate payment for damages
Accept the enhancement formula
Ban alchemical experiments but forgive damages
Make her clean up and work off the debt

cards.title: Mining Camp Contract
cards.description: A dwarf offers a lucrative supply contract
cards.situation: Thorin slams a heavy purse on the bar. 'My mining camp needs a steady supply of ale. Good stuff, mind you - none of that human swill. We pay in gold, monthly.'

options.text: Accept the contract with premium dwarf ale
Negotiate for a better price
Offer regular ale at lower price
Decline - can't meet dwarf standards

cards.title: Elven Wine Connoisseur
cards.description: An elf noble wants to sample your finest wines
cards.situation: Lady Silviana glides in, her entourage in tow. 'I heard you serve wine worthy of elven palates. I shall be the judge of that.' Her approval could bring wealthy clientele.

options.text: Serve your finest vintage wine
Admit you only have common wine
Quickly buy expensive wine from a merchant
Try to pass off regular wine as elven vintage

cards.title: Halfling Eating Contest
cards.description: A halfling proposes an eating contest
cards.situation: Pip hops onto a stool, grinning. 'I bet I can eat more than any three humans! Care to make it interesting? Winner takes all entry fees!'

options.text: Organize the contest with entry fees
Decline but offer an all-you-can-eat special
Challenge him yourself for publicity
Refuse - too messy and wasteful

cards.title: Orc Seeks Acceptance
cards.description: An orc trying to fit in faces discrimination
cards.situation: Gruk sits alone as other patrons move away. 'Me just want drink like everyone else,' he says sadly. How you handle this will affect your tavern's reputation.

options.text: Serve him publicly and welcome him warmly
Serve him quietly in a corner
Ask him to use the back entrance
Refuse service to avoid trouble

cards.title: Unusual Beverage Request
cards.description: A vampire noble has special dietary needs
cards.situation: Count Vladimir adjusts his cape. 'I require... a special vintage. The red kind. I'll pay handsomely for discretion and quality. No questions asked.'

options.text: Provide what he wants discreetly
Offer tomato juice as substitute
Refuse and report to authorities
Negotiate for regular patronage

cards.title: Pirate Crew Celebration
cards.description: Pirates want to celebrate their latest haul
cards.situation: Captain Scarlett kicks open your door, her crew behind her. 'We've just had a very profitable venture! Drinks for everyone! You can handle thirty thirsty pirates, right?'

options.text: Welcome them with open arms
Serve them but water down the drinks
Set a two-drink maximum per pirate
Refuse - too rowdy for your establishment
